bill.title: National Suicide Hotline Designation Act of 2019

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 165, Number 137 (Tuesday, August 20, 2019)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. STEWART:H.R. 4194.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I Sec 8 clause 3[Page H7511]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

item.title: To amend the Communications Act of 1934 to direct the Federal Communications Commission to designate 9-8-8 as the universal telephone number for the purpose of the national suicide prevention and mental health crisis hotline system operating through the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline and through the Veterans Crisis Line, and for other purposes.
National Suicide Hotline Designation Act of 2019
National Suicide Hotline Designation Act of 2019

item.titleType: (Extracted from GPO) Short Titles as Introduced
item.title: National Suicide Hotline Designation Act of 2019

item.name: Introduced in House
item.text:
National Suicide Hotline Designation Act of 2019

This bill requires the Federal Communications Commission to designate 9–8–8 as the universal telephone number for a national suicide prevention and mental-health crisis hotline.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
